main event: A round, head-of-pin-shaped object was observed flying horizontally at an altitude of 1,000 feet over Lake Michigan near Chicago, Illinois.
interesting points: The object was observed by a 32-year-old man from his back porch, moving from east to west.
The object was silent and did not exhibit any unusual maneuvers.
The sighting was reported to the military, and a security officer considered the witness (a former Air Force officer) to be a reliable source.
The report was filed as part of Project Blue Book, the U.S. Air Force's official investigation of unidentified flying objects.
The report describes the object's shape and size but does not provide any information about its speed or any other distinguishing characteristics.
